intro: Goniothalamus longistylus, commonly known as the long-styled goniothalamus, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local communities. Its unique floral structure and medicinal properties make it of interest to botanists and traditional healers alike. Goniothalamus longistylus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
